events.originalText: The Iranian military arrested 15 Royal Navy personnel, claiming that they had entered Iran's territorial waters.
events.subtitle: 2007 Iranian arrest of Royal Navy personnel
events.headline: Iranian military arrests 15 Royal Navy personnel for entering territorial waters

events.originalText: Lee Teng-hui (pictured) was elected President of the Republic of China in the first direct presidential election in Taiwan.
events.subtitle: Lee Teng-hui
events.headline: Lee Teng-hui elected President of Republic of China in Taiwan's first direct election

events.originalText: Aeroflot Flight 593 crashed into a hillside in Russia's Kemerovo Oblast, killing all 75 people on board, after the pilot's 16-year-old son had unknowingly disabled the autopilot while seated at the controls.
events.subtitle: Aeroflot Flight 593
events.headline: Aeroflot Flight 593 crashes in Russia, killing all 75 on board

events.originalText: The demolition of Kowloon Walled City (pictured), a densely crowded slum in Hong Kong, began.
events.subtitle: Kowloon Walled City
events.headline: Demolition of Kowloon Walled City begins in Hong Kong

events.originalText: The Sierra Leone Civil War began with the invasion of the Revolutionary United Front, with support from the special forces of Charles Taylor's National Patriotic Front of Liberia, in  an attempt to overthrow President Joseph Saidu Momoh.
events.subtitle: Sierra Leone Civil War
events.headline: Sierra Leone Civil War starts with invasion by Revolutionary United Front

events.originalText: Two researchers announced the discovery of cold fusion, a claim which was later discredited.
events.subtitle: Cold fusion
events.headline: Researchers claim discovery of cold fusion, later discredited

events.originalText: British journalist David Frost began a series of interviews with former U.S. president Richard Nixon, starting with the Watergate scandal.
events.subtitle: David Frost
events.headline: David Frost interviews Richard Nixon on Watergate scandal

events.originalText: The Nazi Party took the first step in the Gleichschaltung process by having the Enabling Act passed, giving the government the right to make laws without the involvement of the Reichstag.
events.subtitle: Nazi Party
events.headline: Nazi Party passes Enabling Act for Gleichschaltung process

events.originalText: Bhagat Singh, one of the most influential revolutionaries of the Indian independence movement, and two others were executed by the British authorities.
events.subtitle: Bhagat Singh
events.headline: British authorities execute Bhagat Singh and two others

events.originalText: Benito Mussolini and his supporters founded the Fasci Italiani di Combattimento, the predecessor of the National Fascist Party.
events.subtitle: Benito Mussolini
events.headline: Benito Mussolini founds Fasci Italiani di Combattimento

events.originalText: American diplomat Durham Stevens, an employee of Japan's Ministry of Foreign Affairs, was fatally shot in San Francisco by two Korean immigrants unhappy with his support of increased Japanese presence in Korea.
events.subtitle: Durham Stevens
events.headline: American diplomat Durham Stevens shot in San Francisco

events.originalText: About 1,500 Cretans, led by Eleftherios Venizelos, met at the village of Theriso to call for the island's unification with Greece, beginning the Theriso revolt.
events.subtitle: Crete
events.headline: Cretans call for unification with Greece, starting Theriso revolt

events.originalText: Mirza Ghulam Ahmad founded the Ahmadiyya Islamic religious movement in British India.
events.subtitle: Mirza Ghulam Ahmad
events.headline: Mirza Ghulam Ahmad founds Ahmadiyya Islamic movement in British India

events.originalText: Chaired by William McGregor, a meeting of ten English football clubs was held in London, which would eventually result in the establishment of the Football League.
events.subtitle: William McGregor (football)
events.headline: Meeting of English football clubs leads to establishment of Football League

events.originalText: American Civil War: General Stonewall Jackson of the Confederate States Army lost the First Battle of Kernstown, but was still able to prevent the Union Army from reinforcing the Peninsula campaign.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: General Stonewall Jackson loses First Battle of Kernstown

events.originalText: An earthquake struck central Burma, causing significant damage and killing an estimated 300 to 400 people.
events.subtitle: 1839 Ava earthquake
events.headline: Earthquake strikes central Burma, killing hundreds

events.originalText: American Revolution: Patrick Henry made his "Give me liberty, or give me death!" speech to the House of Burgesses of Virginia, urging military action against the British Empire.
events.subtitle: American Revolution
events.headline: Patrick Henry delivers 'Give me liberty, or give me death!' speech

events.originalText: After 175 years of rule, the Trần dynasty of Vietnam was deposed by Hồ Quý Ly, a court official.
events.subtitle: Trần dynasty
events.headline: Trần dynasty of Vietnam deposed after 175 years by Hồ Quý Ly
